g.text: and Web of Science for relevant articles, were systemically
retrieved by 2 authors independently, to collect studies
regarding PVT1 as a prognostic marker for survival of cancer
patients. The latest retrieval was updated on December 16,
cally, literature retrieval was performed by means
of both text word and MeSH strategy using the terms
correspondingly adjusted in different databases. In the retrieval
process, a manual retrieval was also carried out using the
reference lists from relevant articles to recruit eligible studies. All
analyses were performed based on previously published studies.
Thus, no ethic approval and informed consent were required in
All the included studies were evaluated and data were extracted
by two researchers independently. The study inclusion criteria
1. studies in which the role of PVT1 in the development of human
2. studies that described the related clinicopathological parameters;
3. studies that measured the PVT1 expression levels in human
4. studies in which patients were grouped according to the PVT1
The study exclusion criteria were as follows:
1. reviews, letters, editorials, case reports, and expert opinions;
Flowchart showing the steps of study selection in this meta-analysis.
